    view  

    • Uses of Button in view

      Subclasses of Button in view 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  GUI.LoadGame
      Button object.
      (package private) class  GUI.NewGame
      Button makes the operator software create a new power plant.
      (package private) class  GUI.RestartButton
      Button for restarting the operator software.
      (package private) class  GUI.SaveGame
      Button object.
      (package private) class  GUI.ScoresButton
      Button object.
      (package private) class  GUI.StepButton
      Implements Step button functionality.
      (package private) class  GUI.ViewSwitchButton
      These buttons are used for changing the content to be displayed in the sidebar.
      (package private) class  SideBar.IncrementButton 
      (package private) class  SideBar.OnOffButton
      Button that's used for turning on/off the pumps and opening/closing valves.
      (package private) class  SideBar.RepairButton
      Button object.
      class  TextButton
      Acts like a regular Button, however it is also tied to a Text object.
      class  ToggleButton
      Acts like a regular Button, except that if it gets clicked it will stay in a pressed mode rather than idle or mouseOver.
      Methods in view with parameters of type Button 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Button.allign(Button b)
      Position another button to the right of this button
      void Text.allign(Button b, java.awt.FontMetrics metrics)
      Positions a button to the right of where the text ends.
      void Button.allign(Button b, int space)
      Positions another button to the right of this button, leaving the specified space between them
      void Text.nextLine(Button b, java.awt.FontMetrics metrics)
      Positions a button bellow the text object
      void Renderer.queueForRendering(Button b)
      Adds the object to the rendering queue to be rendered to screen on the next repaint call
      void Renderer.registerButton(Button b)
      Register a button so that it would receive messages from the canvas which this renderer renders to.
